page.title: 03N Plumstead Common: 05430178
page.content: The north of the block is bordered by Plumstead Road, an ancient route dating from Saxon times. It separates the former marshland to the north from the higher land to the south. Heavy traffic on this road has long been a problem but extensive roadworks at present underway should ease the congestion. The area has been densely populated since Victorian times and many of the houses built then were for the workers at the nearby Woolwich Arsenal. In the 1960s and 1970s lots of old houses were demolished to make way for blocks of flats & mainsonettes More recent building has seen a return to popular two storey terraces. The area has an increasing population and in the last 15 years there has been one new primary school and a second building for another. Many people commute daily to central London.
